00001 /* stbi-1.16 - public domain JPEG/PNG reader - http://nothings.org/stb_image.c
00002                       when you control the images you're loading
00003 
00004    QUICK NOTES:
00005       Primarily of interest to game developers and other people who can
00006           avoid problematic images and only need the trivial interface
00007 
00008       JPEG baseline (no JPEG progressive, no oddball channel decimations)
00009       PNG non-interlaced
00010       BMP non-1bpp, non-RLE
00011       TGA (not sure what subset, if a subset)
00012       PSD (composited view only, no extra channels)
00013       HDR (radiance rgbE format)
00014       writes BMP,TGA (define STBI_NO_WRITE to remove code)
00015       decoded from memory or through stdio FILE (define STBI_NO_STDIO to remove code)
00016       supports installable dequantizing-IDCT, YCbCr-to-RGB conversion (define STBI_SIMD)
00017         
00018    TODO:
00019       stbi_info_*
00020   
00021    history:
00022       1.16   major bugfix - convert_format converted one too many pixels
00023       1.15   initialize some fields for thread safety
00024       1.14   fix threadsafe conversion bug; header-file-only version (#define STBI_HEADER_FILE_ONLY before including)
00025       1.13   threadsafe
00026       1.12   const qualifiers in the API
00027       1.11   Support installable IDCT, colorspace conversion routines
00028       1.10   Fixes for 64-bit (don't use "unsigned long")
00029              optimized upsampling by Fabian "ryg" Giesen
00030       1.09   Fix format-conversion for PSD code (bad global variables!)
00031       1.08   Thatcher Ulrich's PSD code integrated by Nicolas Schulz
00032       1.07   attempt to fix C++ warning/errors again
00033       1.06   attempt to fix C++ warning/errors again
00034       1.05   fix TGA loading to return correct *comp and use good luminance calc
00035       1.04   default float alpha is 1, not 255; use 'void *' for stbi_image_free
00036       1.03   bugfixes to STBI_NO_STDIO, STBI_NO_HDR
00037       1.02   support for (subset of) HDR files, float interface for preferred access to them
00038       1.01   fix bug: possible bug in handling right-side up bmps... not sure
00039              fix bug: the stbi_bmp_load() and stbi_tga_load() functions didn't work at all
00040       1.00   interface to zlib that skips zlib header
00041       0.99   correct handling of alpha in palette
00042       0.98   TGA loader by lonesock; dynamically add loaders (untested)
00043       0.97   jpeg errors on too large a file; also catch another malloc failure
00044       0.96   fix detection of invalid v value - particleman@mollyrocket forum
00045       0.95   during header scan, seek to markers in case of padding
00046       0.94   STBI_NO_STDIO to disable stdio usage; rename all #defines the same
00047       0.93   handle jpegtran output; verbose errors
00048       0.92   read 4,8,16,24,32-bit BMP files of several formats
00049       0.91   output 24-bit Windows 3.0 BMP files
00050       0.90   fix a few more warnings; bump version number to approach 1.0
00051       0.61   bugfixes due to Marc LeBlanc, Christopher Lloyd
00052       0.60   fix compiling as c++
00053       0.59   fix warnings: merge Dave Moore's -Wall fixes
00054       0.58   fix bug: zlib uncompressed mode len/nlen was wrong endian
00055       0.57   fix bug: jpg last huffman symbol before marker was >9 bits but less
00056                       than 16 available
00057       0.56   fix bug: zlib uncompressed mode len vs. nlen
00058       0.55   fix bug: restart_interval not initialized to 0
00059       0.54   allow NULL for 'int *comp'
00060       0.53   fix bug in png 3->4; speedup png decoding
00061       0.52   png handles req_comp=3,4 directly; minor cleanup; jpeg comments
00062       0.51   obey req_comp requests, 1-component jpegs return as 1-component,
00063              on 'test' only check type, not whether we support this variant
00064 */

00067 #ifndef STBI_INCLUDE_STB_IMAGE_H
00068 #define STBI_INCLUDE_STB_IMAGE_H
00069 
00071 //
00072 // Limitations:
00073 //    - no progressive/interlaced support (jpeg, png)
00074 //    - 8-bit samples only (jpeg, png)
00075 //    - not threadsafe
00076 //    - channel subsampling of at most 2 in each dimension (jpeg)
00077 //    - no delayed line count (jpeg) -- IJG doesn't support either
00078 //
00079 // Basic usage (see HDR discussion below):
00080 //    int x,y,n;
00081 //    unsigned char *data = stbi_load(filename, &x, &y, &n, 0);
00082 //    // ... process data if not NULL ... 
00083 //    // ... x = width, y = height, n = # 8-bit components per pixel ...
00084 //    // ... replace '0' with '1'..'4' to force that many components per pixel
00085 //    stbi_image_free(data)
00086 //
00087 // Standard parameters:
00088 //    int *x       -- outputs image width in pixels
00089 //    int *y       -- outputs image height in pixels
00090 //    int *comp    -- outputs # of image components in image file
00091 //    int req_comp -- if non-zero, # of image components requested in result
00092 //
00093 // The return value from an image loader is an 'unsigned char *' which points
00094 // to the pixel data. The pixel data consists of *y scanlines of *x pixels,
00095 // with each pixel consisting of N interleaved 8-bit components; the first
00096 // pixel pointed to is top-left-most in the image. There is no padding between
00097 // image scanlines or between pixels, regardless of format. The number of
00098 // components N is 'req_comp' if req_comp is non-zero, or *comp otherwise.
00099 // If req_comp is non-zero, *comp has the number of components that _would_
00100 // have been output otherwise. E.g. if you set req_comp to 4, you will always
00101 // get RGBA output, but you can check *comp to easily see if it's opaque.
00102 //
00103 // An output image with N components has the following components interleaved
00104 // in this order in each pixel:
00105 //
00106 //     N=#comp     components
00107 //       1           grey
00108 //       2           grey, alpha
00109 //       3           red, green, blue
00110 //       4           red, green, blue, alpha
00111 //
00112 // If image loading fails for any reason, the return value will be NULL,
00113 // and *x, *y, *comp will be unchanged. The function stbi_failure_reason()
00114 // can be queried for an extremely brief, end-user unfriendly explanation
00115 // of why the load failed. Define STBI_NO_FAILURE_STRINGS to avoid
00116 // compiling these strings at all, and STBI_FAILURE_USERMSG to get slightly
00117 // more user-friendly ones.
00118 //
00119 // Paletted PNG and BMP images are automatically depalettized.
00120 //
00121 //
00122 // ===========================================================================
00123 //
00124 // HDR image support   (disable by defining STBI_NO_HDR)
00125 //
00126 // stb_image now supports loading HDR images in general, and currently
00127 // the Radiance .HDR file format, although the support is provided
00128 // generically. You can still load any file through the existing interface;
00129 // if you attempt to load an HDR file, it will be automatically remapped to
00130 // LDR, assuming gamma 2.2 and an arbitrary scale factor defaulting to 1;
00131 // both of these constants can be reconfigured through this interface:
00132 //
00133 //     stbi_hdr_to_ldr_gamma(2.2f);
00134 //     stbi_hdr_to_ldr_scale(1.0f);
00135 //
00136 // (note, do not use _inverse_ constants; stbi_image will invert them
00137 // appropriately).
00138 //
00139 // Additionally, there is a new, parallel interface for loading files as
00140 // (linear) floats to preserve the full dynamic range:
00141 //
00142 //    float *data = stbi_loadf(filename, &x, &y, &n, 0);
00143 // 
00144 // If you load LDR images through this interface, those images will
00145 // be promoted to floating point values, run through the inverse of
00146 // constants corresponding to the above:
00147 //
00148 //     stbi_ldr_to_hdr_scale(1.0f);
00149 //     stbi_ldr_to_hdr_gamma(2.2f);
00150 //
00151 // Finally, given a filename (or an open file or memory block--see header
00152 // file for details) containing image data, you can query for the "most
00153 // appropriate" interface to use (that is, whether the image is HDR or
00154 // not), using:
00155 //
00156 //     stbi_is_hdr(char *filename);
00157

00160 #endif

00170    STBI_rgb        = 3,
00171    STBI_rgb_alpha  = 4,
00172 };

00310 // define new loaders
00311 typedef struct
00312 {
00313    int       (*test_memory)(stbi_uc const *buffer, int len);
00314    stbi_uc * (*load_from_memory)(stbi_uc const *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp);
00315    #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00316    int       (*test_file)(FILE *f);
00317    stbi_uc * (*load_from_file)(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp);
00318    #endif
00319 } stbi_loader;

00326 // define faster low-level operations (typically SIMD support)
00327 #if STBI_SIMD
00328 typedef void (*stbi_idct_8x8)(uint8 *out, int out_stride, short data[64], unsigned short *dequantize);
00329 // compute an integer IDCT on "input"
00330 //     input[x] = data[x] * dequantize[x]
00331 //     write results to 'out': 64 samples, each run of 8 spaced by 'out_stride'
00332 //                             CLAMP results to 0..255
00333 typedef void (*stbi_YCbCr_to_RGB_run)(uint8 *output, uint8 const *y, uint8 const *cb, uint8 const *cr, int count, int step);
00334 // compute a conversion from YCbCr to RGB
00335 //     'count' pixels
00336 //     write pixels to 'output'; each pixel is 'step' bytes (either 3 or 4; if 4, write '255' as 4th), order R,G,B
00337 //     y: Y input channel
00338 //     cb: Cb input channel; scale/biased to be 0..255
00339 //     cr: Cr input channel; scale/biased to be 0..255
00340 
00341 extern void stbi_install_idct(stbi_idct_8x8 func);
00342 extern void stbi_install_YCbCr_to_RGB(stbi_YCbCr_to_RGB_run func);
00343 #endif // STBI_SIMD

00401 char *stbi_failure_reason(void)
00402 {
00403    return failure_reason;
00404 }
00405 
00406 static int e(char *str)
00407 {
00408    failure_reason = str;
00409    return 0;
00410 }
00411 
00412 #ifdef STBI_NO_FAILURE_STRINGS
00413    #define e(x,y)  0
00414 #elif defined(STBI_FAILURE_USERMSG)
00415    #define e(x,y)  e(y)
00416 #else
00417    #define e(x,y)  e(x)
00418 #endif
00419 
00420 #define epf(x,y)   ((float *) (e(x,y)?NULL:NULL))
00421 #define epuc(x,y)  ((unsigned char *) (e(x,y)?NULL:NULL))

00427 
00428 #define MAX_LOADERS  32
00429 stbi_loader *loaders[MAX_LOADERS];
00430 static int max_loaders = 0;
00431 
00432 int stbi_register_loader(stbi_loader *loader)
00433 {
00434    int i;
00435    for (i=0; i < MAX_LOADERS; ++i) {
00436       // already present?
00437       if (loaders[i] == loader)
00438          return 1;
00439       // end of the list?
00440       if (loaders[i] == NULL) {
00441          loaders[i] = loader;
00442          max_loaders = i+1;
00443          return 1;
00444       }
00445    }
00446    // no room for it
00447    return 0;
00448 }
00449 
00450 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00451 static float   *ldr_to_hdr(stbi_uc *data, int x, int y, int comp);
00452 static stbi_uc *hdr_to_ldr(float   *data, int x, int y, int comp);
00453 #endif
00454 
00455 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00456 unsigned char *stbi_load(char const *filename, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00457 {
00458    FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
00459    unsigned char *result;
00460    if (!f) return epuc("can't fopen", "Unable to open file");
00461    result = stbi_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00462    fclose(f);
00463    return result;
00464 }
00465 
00466 unsigned char *stbi_load_from_file(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00467 {
00468    int i;
00469    if (stbi_jpeg_test_file(f))
00470       return stbi_jpeg_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00471    if (stbi_png_test_file(f))
00472       return stbi_png_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00473    if (stbi_bmp_test_file(f))
00474       return stbi_bmp_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00475    if (stbi_psd_test_file(f))
00476       return stbi_psd_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00477    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00478    if (stbi_hdr_test_file(f)) {
00479       float *hdr = stbi_hdr_load_from_file(f, x,y,comp,req_comp);
00480       return hdr_to_ldr(hdr, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
00481    }
00482    #endif
00483    for (i=0; i < max_loaders; ++i)
00484       if (loaders[i]->test_file(f))
00485          return loaders[i]->load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00486    // test tga last because it's a crappy test!
00487    if (stbi_tga_test_file(f))
00488       return stbi_tga_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00489    return epuc("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
00490 }
00491 #endif
00492 
00493 unsigned char *stbi_load_from_memory(stbi_uc const *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00494 {
00495    int i;
00496    if (stbi_jpeg_test_memory(buffer,len))
00497       return stbi_jpeg_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00498    if (stbi_png_test_memory(buffer,len))
00499       return stbi_png_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00500    if (stbi_bmp_test_memory(buffer,len))
00501       return stbi_bmp_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00502    if (stbi_psd_test_memory(buffer,len))
00503       return stbi_psd_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00504    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00505    if (stbi_hdr_test_memory(buffer, len)) {
00506       float *hdr = stbi_hdr_load_from_memory(buffer, len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00507       return hdr_to_ldr(hdr, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
00508    }
00509    #endif
00510    for (i=0; i < max_loaders; ++i)
00511       if (loaders[i]->test_memory(buffer,len))
00512          return loaders[i]->load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00513    // test tga last because it's a crappy test!
00514    if (stbi_tga_test_memory(buffer,len))
00515       return stbi_tga_load_from_memory(buffer,len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00516    return epuc("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
00517 }
00518 
00519 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00520 
00521 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00522 float *stbi_loadf(char const *filename, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00523 {
00524    FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
00525    float *result;
00526    if (!f) return epf("can't fopen", "Unable to open file");
00527    result = stbi_loadf_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00528    fclose(f);
00529    return result;
00530 }
00531 
00532 float *stbi_loadf_from_file(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00533 {
00534    unsigned char *data;
00535    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00536    if (stbi_hdr_test_file(f))
00537       return stbi_hdr_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00538    #endif
00539    data = stbi_load_from_file(f, x, y, comp, req_comp);
00540    if (data)
00541       return ldr_to_hdr(data, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
00542    return epf("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
00543 }
00544 #endif
00545 
00546 float *stbi_loadf_from_memory(stbi_uc const *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
00547 {
00548    stbi_uc *data;
00549    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00550    if (stbi_hdr_test_memory(buffer, len))
00551       return stbi_hdr_load_from_memory(buffer, len,x,y,comp,req_comp);
00552    #endif
00553    data = stbi_load_from_memory(buffer, len, x, y, comp, req_comp);
00554    if (data)
00555       return ldr_to_hdr(data, *x, *y, req_comp ? req_comp : *comp);
00556    return epf("unknown image type", "Image not of any known type, or corrupt");
00557 }
00558 #endif

00560 // these is-hdr-or-not is defined independent of whether STBI_NO_HDR is
00561 // defined, for API simplicity; if STBI_NO_HDR is defined, it always
00562 // reports false!

00565 {
00566    #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00567    return stbi_hdr_test_memory(buffer, len);
00568    #else
00569    return 0;
00570    #endif
00571 }

00596 // @TODO: get image dimensions & components without fully decoding
00597 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00598 extern int      stbi_info            (char const *filename,           int *x, int *y, int *comp);
00599 extern int      stbi_info_from_file  (FILE *f,                  int *x, int *y, int *comp);

00602 
00603 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00604 static float h2l_gamma_i=1.0f/2.2f, h2l_scale_i=1.0f;
00605 static float l2h_gamma=2.2f, l2h_scale=1.0f;
00606 
00607 void   stbi_hdr_to_ldr_gamma(float gamma) { h2l_gamma_i = 1/gamma; }
00608 void   stbi_hdr_to_ldr_scale(float scale) { h2l_scale_i = 1/scale; }
00609 
00610 void   stbi_ldr_to_hdr_gamma(float gamma) { l2h_gamma = gamma; }
00611 void   stbi_ldr_to_hdr_scale(float scale) { l2h_scale = scale; }
00612 #endif
00613 
00614 
00616 //
00617 // Common code used by all image loaders
00618 //
00619 
00620 enum
00621 {
00622    SCAN_load=0,
00623    SCAN_type,
00624    SCAN_header,
00625 };
00626 
00627 typedef struct
00628 {
00629    uint32 img_x, img_y;
00630    int img_n, img_out_n;
00631 
00632    #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00633    FILE  *img_file;
00634    #endif
00635    uint8 *img_buffer, *img_buffer_end;
00636 } stbi;
00637 
00638 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00639 static void start_file(stbi *s, FILE *f)
00640 {
00641    s->img_file = f;
00642 }
00643 #endif
00644 
00645 static void start_mem(stbi *s, uint8 const *buffer, int len)
00646 {
00647 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00648    s->img_file = NULL;
00649 #endif
00650    s->img_buffer = (uint8 *) buffer;
00651    s->img_buffer_end = (uint8 *) buffer+len;
00652 }
00653 
00654 __forceinline static int get8(stbi *s)
00655 {
00656 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00657    if (s->img_file) {
00658       int c = fgetc(s->img_file);
00659       return c == EOF ? 0 : c;
00660    }
00661 #endif
00662    if (s->img_buffer < s->img_buffer_end)
00663       return *s->img_buffer++;
00664    return 0;
00665 }
00666 
00667 __forceinline static int at_eof(stbi *s)
00668 {
00669 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00670    if (s->img_file)
00671       return feof(s->img_file);
00672 #endif
00673    return s->img_buffer >= s->img_buffer_end;   
00674 }
00675 
00676 __forceinline static uint8 get8u(stbi *s)
00677 {
00678    return (uint8) get8(s);
00679 }
00680 
00681 static void skip(stbi *s, int n)
00682 {
00683 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00684    if (s->img_file)
00685       fseek(s->img_file, n, SEEK_CUR);
00686    else
00687 #endif
00688       s->img_buffer += n;
00689 }
00690 
00691 static int get16(stbi *s)
00692 {
00693    int z = get8(s);
00694    return (z << 8) + get8(s);
00695 }
00696 
00697 static uint32 get32(stbi *s)
00698 {
00699    uint32 z = get16(s);
00700    return (z << 16) + get16(s);
00701 }
00702 
00703 static int get16le(stbi *s)
00704 {
00705    int z = get8(s);
00706    return z + (get8(s) << 8);
00707 }
00708 
00709 static uint32 get32le(stbi *s)
00710 {
00711    uint32 z = get16le(s);
00712    return z + (get16le(s) << 16);
00713 }
00714 
00715 static void getn(stbi *s, stbi_uc *buffer, int n)
00716 {
00717 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
00718    if (s->img_file) {
00719       fread(buffer, 1, n, s->img_file);
00720       return;
00721    }
00722 #endif
00723    memcpy(buffer, s->img_buffer, n);
00724    s->img_buffer += n;
00725 }
00726 
00728 //
00729 //  generic converter from built-in img_n to req_comp
00730 //    individual types do this automatically as much as possible (e.g. jpeg
00731 //    does all cases internally since it needs to colorspace convert anyway,
00732 //    and it never has alpha, so very few cases ). png can automatically
00733 //    interleave an alpha=255 channel, but falls back to this for other cases
00734 //
00735 //  assume data buffer is malloced, so malloc a new one and free that one
00736 //  only failure mode is malloc failing
00737 
00738 static uint8 compute_y(int r, int g, int b)
00739 {
00740    return (uint8) (((r*77) + (g*150) +  (29*b)) >> 8);
00741 }
00742 
00743 static unsigned char *convert_format(unsigned char *data, int img_n, int req_comp, uint x, uint y)
00744 {
00745    int i,j;
00746    unsigned char *good;
00747 
00748    if (req_comp == img_n) return data;
00749    assert(req_comp >= 1 && req_comp <= 4);
00750 
00751    good = (unsigned char *) malloc(req_comp * x * y);
00752    if (good == NULL) {
00753       free(data);
00754       return epuc("outofmem", "Out of memory");
00755    }
00756 
00757    for (j=0; j < (int) y; ++j) {
00758       unsigned char *src  = data + j * x * img_n   ;
00759       unsigned char *dest = good + j * x * req_comp;
00760 
00761       #define COMBO(a,b)  ((a)*8+(b))
00762       #define CASE(a,b)   case COMBO(a,b): for(i=x-1; i >= 0; --i, src += a, dest += b)
00763       // convert source image with img_n components to one with req_comp components;
00764       // avoid switch per pixel, so use switch per scanline and massive macros
00765       switch(COMBO(img_n, req_comp)) {
00766          CASE(1,2) dest[0]=src[0], dest[1]=255; break;
00767          CASE(1,3) dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0]; break;
00768          CASE(1,4) dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0], dest[3]=255; break;
00769          CASE(2,1) dest[0]=src[0]; break;
00770          CASE(2,3) dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0]; break;
00771          CASE(2,4) dest[0]=dest[1]=dest[2]=src[0], dest[3]=src[1]; break;
00772          CASE(3,4) dest[0]=src[0],dest[1]=src[1],dest[2]=src[2],dest[3]=255; break;
00773          CASE(3,1) dest[0]=compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]); break;
00774          CASE(3,2) dest[0]=compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]), dest[1] = 255; break;
00775          CASE(4,1) dest[0]=compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]); break;
00776          CASE(4,2) dest[0]=compute_y(src[0],src[1],src[2]), dest[1] = src[3]; break;
00777          CASE(4,3) dest[0]=src[0],dest[1]=src[1],dest[2]=src[2]; break;
00778          default: assert(0);
00779       }
00780       #undef CASE
00781    }
00782 
00783    free(data);
00784    return good;
00785 }
00786 
00787 #ifndef STBI_NO_HDR
00788 static float   *ldr_to_hdr(stbi_uc *data, int x, int y, int comp)
00789 {
00790    int i,k,n;
00791    float *output = (float *) malloc(x * y * comp * sizeof(float));
00792    if (output == NULL) { free(data); return epf("outofmem", "Out of memory"); }
00793    // compute number of non-alpha components
00794    if (comp & 1) n = comp; else n = comp-1;
00795    for (i=0; i < x*y; ++i) {
00796       for (k=0; k < n; ++k) {
00797          output[i*comp + k] = (float) pow(data[i*comp+k]/255.0f, l2h_gamma) * l2h_scale;
00798       }
00799       if (k < comp) output[i*comp + k] = data[i*comp+k]/255.0f;
00800    }
00801    free(data);
00802    return output;
00803 }
00804 
00805 #define float2int(x)   ((int) (x))
00806 static stbi_uc *hdr_to_ldr(float   *data, int x, int y, int comp)
00807 {
00808    int i,k,n;
00809    stbi_uc *output = (stbi_uc *) malloc(x * y * comp);
00810    if (output == NULL) { free(data); return epuc("outofmem", "Out of memory"); }
00811    // compute number of non-alpha components
00812    if (comp & 1) n = comp; else n = comp-1;
00813    for (i=0; i < x*y; ++i) {
00814       for (k=0; k < n; ++k) {
00815          float z = (float) pow(data[i*comp+k]*h2l_scale_i, h2l_gamma_i) * 255 + 0.5f;
00816          if (z < 0) z = 0;
00817          if (z > 255) z = 255;
00818          output[i*comp + k] = float2int(z);
00819       }
00820       if (k < comp) {
00821          float z = data[i*comp+k] * 255 + 0.5f;
00822          if (z < 0) z = 0;
00823          if (z > 255) z = 255;
00824          output[i*comp + k] = float2int(z);
00825       }
00826    }
00827    free(data);
00828    return output;
00829 }
00830 #endif
00831 
00833 //
00834 //  "baseline" JPEG/JFIF decoder (not actually fully baseline implementation)
00835 //
00836 //    simple implementation
00837 //      - channel subsampling of at most 2 in each dimension
00838 //      - doesn't support delayed output of y-dimension
00839 //      - simple interface (only one output format: 8-bit interleaved RGB)
00840 //      - doesn't try to recover corrupt jpegs
00841 //      - doesn't allow partial loading, loading multiple at once
00842 //      - still fast on x86 (copying globals into locals doesn't help x86)
00843 //      - allocates lots of intermediate memory (full size of all components)
00844 //        - non-interleaved case requires this anyway
00845 //        - allows good upsampling (see next)
00846 //    high-quality
00847 //      - upsampled channels are bilinearly interpolated, even across blocks
00848 //      - quality integer IDCT derived from IJG's 'slow'
00849 //    performance
00850 //      - fast huffman; reasonable integer IDCT
00851 //      - uses a lot of intermediate memory, could cache poorly
00852 //      - load http://nothings.org/remote/anemones.jpg 3 times on 2.8Ghz P4
00853 //          stb_jpeg:   1.34 seconds (MSVC6, default release build)
00854 //          stb_jpeg:   1.06 seconds (MSVC6, processor = Pentium Pro)
00855 //          IJL11.dll:  1.08 seconds (compiled by intel)
00856 //          IJG 1998:   0.98 seconds (MSVC6, makefile provided by IJG)
00857 //          IJG 1998:   0.95 seconds (MSVC6, makefile + proc=PPro)
00858 
00859 // huffman decoding acceleration
00860 #define FAST_BITS   9  // larger handles more cases; smaller stomps less cache
00861 
00862 typedef struct
00863 {
00864    uint8  fast[1 << FAST_BITS];
00865    // weirdly, repacking this into AoS is a 10% speed loss, instead of a win
00866    uint16 code[256];
00867    uint8  values[256];
00868    uint8  size[257];
00869    unsigned int maxcode[18];
00870    int    delta[17];   // old 'firstsymbol' - old 'firstcode'
00871 } huffman;
00872 
00873 typedef struct
00874 {
00875    #if STBI_SIMD
00876    unsigned short dequant2[4][64];
00877    #endif
00878    stbi s;
00879    huffman huff_dc[4];
00880    huffman huff_ac[4];
00881    uint8 dequant[4][64];
00882 
00883 // sizes for components, interleaved MCUs
00884    int img_h_max, img_v_max;
00885    int img_mcu_x, img_mcu_y;
00886    int img_mcu_w, img_mcu_h;
00887 
00888 // definition of jpeg image component
00889    struct
00890    {
00891       int id;
00892       int h,v;
00893       int tq;
00894       int hd,ha;
00895       int dc_pred;
00896 
00897       int x,y,w2,h2;
00898       uint8 *data;
00899       void *raw_data;
00900       uint8 *linebuf;
00901    } img_comp[4];
00902 
00903    uint32         code_buffer; // jpeg entropy-coded buffer
00904    int            code_bits;   // number of valid bits
00905    unsigned char  marker;      // marker seen while filling entropy buffer
00906    int            nomore;      // flag if we saw a marker so must stop
00907 
00908    int scan_n, order[4];
00909    int restart_interval, todo;
00910 } jpeg;
00911 
00912 static int build_huffman(huffman *h, int *count)
00913 {
00914    int i,j,k=0,code;
00915    // build size list for each symbol (from JPEG spec)
00916    for (i=0; i < 16; ++i)
00917       for (j=0; j < count[i]; ++j)
00918          h->size[k++] = (uint8) (i+1);
00919    h->size[k] = 0;
00920 
00921    // compute actual symbols (from jpeg spec)
00922    code = 0;
00923    k = 0;
00924    for(j=1; j <= 16; ++j) {
00925       // compute delta to add to code to compute symbol id
00926       h->delta[j] = k - code;
00927       if (h->size[k] == j) {
00928          while (h->size[k] == j)
00929             h->code[k++] = (uint16) (code++);
00930          if (code-1 >= (1 << j)) return e("bad code lengths","Corrupt JPEG");
00931       }
00932       // compute largest code + 1 for this size, preshifted as needed later
00933       h->maxcode[j] = code << (16-j);
00934       code <<= 1;
00935    }
00936    h->maxcode[j] = 0xffffffff;
00937 
00938    // build non-spec acceleration table; 255 is flag for not-accelerated
00939    memset(h->fast, 255, 1 << FAST_BITS);
00940    for (i=0; i < k; ++i) {
00941       int s = h->size[i];
00942       if (s <= FAST_BITS) {
00943          int c = h->code[i] << (FAST_BITS-s);
00944          int m = 1 << (FAST_BITS-s);
00945          for (j=0; j < m; ++j) {
00946             h->fast[c+j] = (uint8) i;
00947          }
00948       }
00949    }
00950    return 1;
00951 }
00952 
00953 static void grow_buffer_unsafe(jpeg *j)
00954 {
00955    do {
00956       int b = j->nomore ? 0 : get8(&j->s);
00957       if (b == 0xff) {
00958          int c = get8(&j->s);
00959          if (c != 0) {
00960             j->marker = (unsigned char) c;
00961             j->nomore = 1;
00962             return;
00963          }
00964       }
00965       j->code_buffer = (j->code_buffer << 8) | b;
00966       j->code_bits += 8;
00967    } while (j->code_bits <= 24);
00968 }
00969 
00970 // (1 << n) - 1
00971 static uint32 bmask[17]={0,1,3,7,15,31,63,127,255,511,1023,2047,4095,8191,16383,32767,65535};
00972 
00973 // decode a jpeg huffman value from the bitstream
00974 __forceinline static int decode(jpeg *j, huffman *h)
00975 {
00976    unsigned int temp;
00977    int c,k;
00978 
00979    if (j->code_bits < 16) grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
00980 
00981    // look at the top FAST_BITS and determine what symbol ID it is,
00982    // if the code is <= FAST_BITS
00983    c = (j->code_buffer >> (j->code_bits - FAST_BITS)) & ((1 << FAST_BITS)-1);
00984    k = h->fast[c];
00985    if (k < 255) {
00986       if (h->size[k] > j->code_bits)
00987          return -1;
00988       j->code_bits -= h->size[k];
00989       return h->values[k];
00990    }
00991 
00992    // naive test is to shift the code_buffer down so k bits are
00993    // valid, then test against maxcode. To speed this up, we've
00994    // preshifted maxcode left so that it has (16-k) 0s at the
00995    // end; in other words, regardless of the number of bits, it
00996    // wants to be compared against something shifted to have 16;
00997    // that way we don't need to shift inside the loop.
00998    if (j->code_bits < 16)
00999       temp = (j->code_buffer << (16 - j->code_bits)) & 0xffff;
01000    else
01001       temp = (j->code_buffer >> (j->code_bits - 16)) & 0xffff;
01002    for (k=FAST_BITS+1 ; ; ++k)
01003       if (temp < h->maxcode[k])
01004          break;
01005    if (k == 17) {
01006       // error! code not found
01007       j->code_bits -= 16;
01008       return -1;
01009    }
01010 
01011    if (k > j->code_bits)
01012       return -1;
01013 
01014    // convert the huffman code to the symbol id
01015    c = ((j->code_buffer >> (j->code_bits - k)) & bmask[k]) + h->delta[k];
01016    assert((((j->code_buffer) >> (j->code_bits - h->size[c])) & bmask[h->size[c]]) == h->code[c]);
01017 
01018    // convert the id to a symbol
01019    j->code_bits -= k;
01020    return h->values[c];
01021 }
01022 
01023 // combined JPEG 'receive' and JPEG 'extend', since baseline
01024 // always extends everything it receives.
01025 __forceinline static int extend_receive(jpeg *j, int n)
01026 {
01027    unsigned int m = 1 << (n-1);
01028    unsigned int k;
01029    if (j->code_bits < n) grow_buffer_unsafe(j);
01030    k = (j->code_buffer >> (j->code_bits - n)) & bmask[n];
01031    j->code_bits -= n;
01032    // the following test is probably a random branch that won't
01033    // predict well. I tried to table accelerate it but failed.
01034    // maybe it's compiling as a conditional move?
01035    if (k < m)
01036       return (-1 << n) + k + 1;
01037    else
01038       return k;
01039 }
01040 
01041 // given a value that's at position X in the zigzag stream,
01042 // where does it appear in the 8x8 matrix coded as row-major?
01043 static uint8 dezigzag[64+15] =
01044 {
01045     0,  1,  8, 16,  9,  2,  3, 10,
01046    17, 24, 32, 25, 18, 11,  4,  5,
01047    12, 19, 26, 33, 40, 48, 41, 34,
01048    27, 20, 13,  6,  7, 14, 21, 28,
01049    35, 42, 49, 56, 57, 50, 43, 36,
01050    29, 22, 15, 23, 30, 37, 44, 51,
01051    58, 59, 52, 45, 38, 31, 39, 46,
01052    53, 60, 61, 54, 47, 55, 62, 63,
01053    // let corrupt input sample past end
01054    63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63,
01055    63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63, 63
01056 };
01057 
01058 // decode one 64-entry block--
01059 static int decode_block(jpeg *j, short data[64], huffman *hdc, huffman *hac, int b)
01060 {
01061    int diff,dc,k;
01062    int t = decode(j, hdc);
01063    if (t < 0) return e("bad huffman code","Corrupt JPEG");
01064 
01065    // 0 all the ac values now so we can do it 32-bits at a time
01066    memset(data,0,64*sizeof(data[0]));
01067 
01068    diff = t ? extend_receive(j, t) : 0;
01069    dc = j->img_comp[b].dc_pred + diff;
01070    j->img_comp[b].dc_pred = dc;
01071    data[0] = (short) dc;
01072 
01073    // decode AC components, see JPEG spec
01074    k = 1;
01075    do {
01076       int r,s;
01077       int rs = decode(j, hac);
01078       if (rs < 0) return e("bad huffman code","Corrupt JPEG");
01079       s = rs & 15;
01080       r = rs >> 4;
01081       if (s == 0) {
01082          if (rs != 0xf0) break; // end block
01083          k += 16;
01084       } else {
01085          k += r;
01086          // decode into unzigzag'd location
01087          data[dezigzag[k++]] = (short) extend_receive(j,s);
01088       }
01089    } while (k < 64);
01090    return 1;
01091 }
01092 
01093 // take a -128..127 value and clamp it and convert to 0..255
01094 __forceinline static uint8 clamp(int x)
01095 {
01096    x += 128;
01097    // trick to use a single test to catch both cases
01098    if ((unsigned int) x > 255) {
01099       if (x < 0) return 0;
01100       if (x > 255) return 255;
01101    }
01102    return (uint8) x;
01103 }
01104 
01105 #define f2f(x)  (int) (((x) * 4096 + 0.5))
01106 #define fsh(x)  ((x) << 12)
01107 
01108 // derived from jidctint -- DCT_ISLOW
01109 #define IDCT_1D(s0,s1,s2,s3,s4,s5,s6,s7)       \
01110    int t0,t1,t2,t3,p1,p2,p3,p4,p5,x0,x1,x2,x3; \
01111    p2 = s2;                                    \
01112    p3 = s6;                                    \
01113    p1 = (p2+p3) * f2f(0.5411961f);             \
01114    t2 = p1 + p3*f2f(-1.847759065f);            \
01115    t3 = p1 + p2*f2f( 0.765366865f);            \
01116    p2 = s0;                                    \
01117    p3 = s4;                                    \
01118    t0 = fsh(p2+p3);                            \
01119    t1 = fsh(p2-p3);                            \
01120    x0 = t0+t3;                                 \
01121    x3 = t0-t3;                                 \
01122    x1 = t1+t2;                                 \
01123    x2 = t1-t2;                                 \
01124    t0 = s7;                                    \
01125    t1 = s5;                                    \
01126    t2 = s3;                                    \
01127    t3 = s1;                                    \
01128    p3 = t0+t2;                                 \
01129    p4 = t1+t3;                                 \
01130    p1 = t0+t3;                                 \
01131    p2 = t1+t2;                                 \
01132    p5 = (p3+p4)*f2f( 1.175875602f);            \
01133    t0 = t0*f2f( 0.298631336f);                 \
01134    t1 = t1*f2f( 2.053119869f);                 \
01135    t2 = t2*f2f( 3.072711026f);                 \
01136    t3 = t3*f2f( 1.501321110f);                 \
01137    p1 = p5 + p1*f2f(-0.899976223f);            \
01138    p2 = p5 + p2*f2f(-2.562915447f);            \
01139    p3 = p3*f2f(-1.961570560f);                 \
01140    p4 = p4*f2f(-0.390180644f);                 \
01141    t3 += p1+p4;                                \
01142    t2 += p2+p3;                                \
01143    t1 += p2+p4;                                \
01144    t0 += p1+p3;
01145 
01146 #if !STBI_SIMD
01147 // .344 seconds on 3*anemones.jpg
01148 static void idct_block(uint8 *out, int out_stride, short data[64], uint8 *dequantize)
01149 {
01150    int i,val[64],*v=val;
01151    uint8 *o,*dq = dequantize;
01152    short *d = data;
01153 
01154    // columns
01155    for (i=0; i < 8; ++i,++d,++dq, ++v) {
01156       // if all zeroes, shortcut -- this avoids dequantizing 0s and IDCTing
01157       if (d[ 8]==0 && d[16]==0 && d[24]==0 && d[32]==0
01158            && d[40]==0 && d[48]==0 && d[56]==0) {
01159          //    no shortcut                 0     seconds
01160          //    (1|2|3|4|5|6|7)==0          0     seconds
01161          //    all separate               -0.047 seconds
01162          //    1 && 2|3 && 4|5 && 6|7:    -0.047 seconds
01163          int dcterm = d[0] * dq[0] << 2;
01164          v[0] = v[8] = v[16] = v[24] = v[32] = v[40] = v[48] = v[56] = dcterm;
01165       } else {
01166          IDCT_1D(d[ 0]*dq[ 0],d[ 8]*dq[ 8],d[16]*dq[16],d[24]*dq[24],
01167                  d[32]*dq[32],d[40]*dq[40],d[48]*dq[48],d[56]*dq[56])
01168          // constants scaled things up by 1<<12; let's bring them back
01169          // down, but keep 2 extra bits of precision
01170          x0 += 512; x1 += 512; x2 += 512; x3 += 512;
01171          v[ 0] = (x0+t3) >> 10;
01172          v[56] = (x0-t3) >> 10;
01173          v[ 8] = (x1+t2) >> 10;
01174          v[48] = (x1-t2) >> 10;
01175          v[16] = (x2+t1) >> 10;
01176          v[40] = (x2-t1) >> 10;
01177          v[24] = (x3+t0) >> 10;
01178          v[32] = (x3-t0) >> 10;
01179       }
01180    }
01181 
01182    for (i=0, v=val, o=out; i < 8; ++i,v+=8,o+=out_stride) {
01183       // no fast case since the first 1D IDCT spread components out
01184       IDCT_1D(v[0],v[1],v[2],v[3],v[4],v[5],v[6],v[7])
01185       // constants scaled things up by 1<<12, plus we had 1<<2 from first
01186       // loop, plus horizontal and vertical each scale by sqrt(8) so together
01187       // we've got an extra 1<<3, so 1<<17 total we need to remove.
01188       x0 += 65536; x1 += 65536; x2 += 65536; x3 += 65536;
01189       o[0] = clamp((x0+t3) >> 17);
01190       o[7] = clamp((x0-t3) >> 17);
01191       o[1] = clamp((x1+t2) >> 17);
01192       o[6] = clamp((x1-t2) >> 17);
01193       o[2] = clamp((x2+t1) >> 17);
01194       o[5] = clamp((x2-t1) >> 17);
01195       o[3] = clamp((x3+t0) >> 17);
01196       o[4] = clamp((x3-t0) >> 17);
01197    }
01198 }
01199 #else
01200 static void idct_block(uint8 *out, int out_stride, short data[64], unsigned short *dequantize)
01201 {
01202    int i,val[64],*v=val;
01203    uint8 *o;
01204    unsigned short *dq = dequantize;
01205    short *d = data;
01206 
01207    // columns
01208    for (i=0; i < 8; ++i,++d,++dq, ++v) {
01209       // if all zeroes, shortcut -- this avoids dequantizing 0s and IDCTing
01210       if (d[ 8]==0 && d[16]==0 && d[24]==0 && d[32]==0
01211            && d[40]==0 && d[48]==0 && d[56]==0) {
01212          //    no shortcut                 0     seconds
01213          //    (1|2|3|4|5|6|7)==0          0     seconds
01214          //    all separate               -0.047 seconds
01215          //    1 && 2|3 && 4|5 && 6|7:    -0.047 seconds
01216          int dcterm = d[0] * dq[0] << 2;
01217          v[0] = v[8] = v[16] = v[24] = v[32] = v[40] = v[48] = v[56] = dcterm;
01218       } else {
01219          IDCT_1D(d[ 0]*dq[ 0],d[ 8]*dq[ 8],d[16]*dq[16],d[24]*dq[24],
01220                  d[32]*dq[32],d[40]*dq[40],d[48]*dq[48],d[56]*dq[56])
01221          // constants scaled things up by 1<<12; let's bring them back
01222          // down, but keep 2 extra bits of precision
01223          x0 += 512; x1 += 512; x2 += 512; x3 += 512;
01224          v[ 0] = (x0+t3) >> 10;
01225          v[56] = (x0-t3) >> 10;
01226          v[ 8] = (x1+t2) >> 10;
01227          v[48] = (x1-t2) >> 10;
01228          v[16] = (x2+t1) >> 10;
01229          v[40] = (x2-t1) >> 10;
01230          v[24] = (x3+t0) >> 10;
01231          v[32] = (x3-t0) >> 10;
01232       }
01233    }
01234 
01235    for (i=0, v=val, o=out; i < 8; ++i,v+=8,o+=out_stride) {
01236       // no fast case since the first 1D IDCT spread components out
01237       IDCT_1D(v[0],v[1],v[2],v[3],v[4],v[5],v[6],v[7])
01238       // constants scaled things up by 1<<12, plus we had 1<<2 from first
01239       // loop, plus horizontal and vertical each scale by sqrt(8) so together
01240       // we've got an extra 1<<3, so 1<<17 total we need to remove.
01241       x0 += 65536; x1 += 65536; x2 += 65536; x3 += 65536;
01242       o[0] = clamp((x0+t3) >> 17);
01243       o[7] = clamp((x0-t3) >> 17);
01244       o[1] = clamp((x1+t2) >> 17);
01245       o[6] = clamp((x1-t2) >> 17);
01246       o[2] = clamp((x2+t1) >> 17);
01247       o[5] = clamp((x2-t1) >> 17);
01248       o[3] = clamp((x3+t0) >> 17);
01249       o[4] = clamp((x3-t0) >> 17);
01250    }
01251 }
01252 static stbi_idct_8x8 stbi_idct_installed = idct_block;
01253 
01254 extern void stbi_install_idct(stbi_idct_8x8 func)
01255 {
01256    stbi_idct_installed = func;
01257 }
01258 #endif
01259 
01260 #define MARKER_none  0xff
01261 // if there's a pending marker from the entropy stream, return that
01262 // otherwise, fetch from the stream and get a marker. if there's no
01263 // marker, return 0xff, which is never a valid marker value
01264 static uint8 get_marker(jpeg *j)
01265 {
01266    uint8 x;
01267    if (j->marker != MARKER_none) { x = j->marker; j->marker = MARKER_none; return x; }
01268    x = get8u(&j->s);
01269    if (x != 0xff) return MARKER_none;
01270    while (x == 0xff)
01271       x = get8u(&j->s);
01272    return x;
01273 }
01274 
01275 // in each scan, we'll have scan_n components, and the order
01276 // of the components is specified by order[]
01277 #define RESTART(x)     ((x) >= 0xd0 && (x) <= 0xd7)
01278 
01279 // after a restart interval, reset the entropy decoder and
01280 // the dc prediction
01281 static void reset(jpeg *j)
01282 {
01283    j->code_bits = 0;
01284    j->code_buffer = 0;
01285    j->nomore = 0;
01286    j->img_comp[0].dc_pred = j->img_comp[1].dc_pred = j->img_comp[2].dc_pred = 0;
01287    j->marker = MARKER_none;
01288    j->todo = j->restart_interval ? j->restart_interval : 0x7fffffff;
01289    // no more than 1<<31 MCUs if no restart_interal? that's plenty safe,
01290    // since we don't even allow 1<<30 pixels
01291 }
01292 
01293 static int parse_entropy_coded_data(jpeg *z)
01294 {
01295    reset(z);
01296    if (z->scan_n == 1) {
01297       int i,j;
01298       #if STBI_SIMD
01299       __declspec(align(16))
01300       #endif
01301       short data[64];
01302       int n = z->order[0];
01303       // non-interleaved data, we just need to process one block at a time,
01304       // in trivial scanline order
01305       // number of blocks to do just depends on how many actual "pixels" this
01306       // component has, independent of interleaved MCU blocking and such
01307       int w = (z->img_comp[n].x+7) >> 3;
01308       int h = (z->img_comp[n].y+7) >> 3;
01309       for (j=0; j < h; ++j) {
01310          for (i=0; i < w; ++i) {
01311             if (!decode_block(z, data, z->huff_dc+z->img_comp[n].hd, z->huff_ac+z->img_comp[n].ha, n)) return 0;
01312             #if STBI_SIMD
01313             stbi_idct_installed(z->img_comp[n].data+z->img_comp[n].w2*j*8+i*8, z->img_comp[n].w2, data, z->dequant2[z->img_comp[n].tq]);
01314             #else
01315             idct_block(z->img_comp[n].data+z->img_comp[n].w2*j*8+i*8, z->img_comp[n].w2, data, z->dequant[z->img_comp[n].tq]);
01316             #endif
01317             // every data block is an MCU, so countdown the restart interval
01318             if (--z->todo <= 0) {
01319                if (z->code_bits < 24) grow_buffer_unsafe(z);
01320                // if it's NOT a restart, then just bail, so we get corrupt data
01321                // rather than no data
01322                if (!RESTART(z->marker)) return 1;
01323                reset(z);
01324             }
01325          }
01326       }
01327    } else { // interleaved!
01328       int i,j,k,x,y;
01329       short data[64];
01330       for (j=0; j < z->img_mcu_y; ++j) {
01331          for (i=0; i < z->img_mcu_x; ++i) {
01332             // scan an interleaved mcu... process scan_n components in order
01333             for (k=0; k < z->scan_n; ++k) {
01334                int n = z->order[k];
01335                // scan out an mcu's worth of this component; that's just determined
01336                // by the basic H and V specified for the component
01337                for (y=0; y < z->img_comp[n].v; ++y) {
01338                   for (x=0; x < z->img_comp[n].h; ++x) {
01339                      int x2 = (i*z->img_comp[n].h + x)*8;
01340                      int y2 = (j*z->img_comp[n].v + y)*8;
01341                      if (!decode_block(z, data, z->huff_dc+z->img_comp[n].hd, z->huff_ac+z->img_comp[n].ha, n)) return 0;
01342                      #if STBI_SIMD
01343                      stbi_idct_installed(z->img_comp[n].data+z->img_comp[n].w2*y2+x2, z->img_comp[n].w2, data, z->dequant2[z->img_comp[n].tq]);
01344                      #else
01345                      idct_block(z->img_comp[n].data+z->img_comp[n].w2*y2+x2, z->img_comp[n].w2, data, z->dequant[z->img_comp[n].tq]);
01346                      #endif
01347                   }
01348                }
01349             }
01350             // after all interleaved components, that's an interleaved MCU,
01351             // so now count down the restart interval
01352             if (--z->todo <= 0) {
01353                if (z->code_bits < 24) grow_buffer_unsafe(z);
01354                // if it's NOT a restart, then just bail, so we get corrupt data
01355                // rather than no data
01356                if (!RESTART(z->marker)) return 1;
01357                reset(z);
01358             }
01359          }
01360       }
01361    }
01362    return 1;
01363 }
01364 
01365 static int process_marker(jpeg *z, int m)
01366 {
01367    int L;
01368    switch (m) {
01369       case MARKER_none: // no marker found
01370          return e("expected marker","Corrupt JPEG");
01371 
01372       case 0xC2: // SOF - progressive
01373          return e("progressive jpeg","JPEG format not supported (progressive)");
01374 
01375       case 0xDD: // DRI - specify restart interval
01376          if (get16(&z->s) != 4) return e("bad DRI len","Corrupt JPEG");
01377          z->restart_interval = get16(&z->s);
01378          return 1;
01379 
01380       case 0xDB: // DQT - define quantization table
01381          L = get16(&z->s)-2;
01382          while (L > 0) {
01383             int q = get8(&z->s);
01384             int p = q >> 4;
01385             int t = q & 15,i;
01386             if (p != 0) return e("bad DQT type","Corrupt JPEG");
01387             if (t > 3) return e("bad DQT table","Corrupt JPEG");
01388             for (i=0; i < 64; ++i)
01389                z->dequant[t][dezigzag[i]] = get8u(&z->s);
01390             #if STBI_SIMD
01391             for (i=0; i < 64; ++i)
01392                z->dequant2[t][i] = dequant[t][i];
01393             #endif
01394             L -= 65;
01395          }
01396          return L==0;
01397 
01398       case 0xC4: // DHT - define huffman table
01399          L = get16(&z->s)-2;
01400          while (L > 0) {
01401             uint8 *v;
01402             int sizes[16],i,m=0;
01403             int q = get8(&z->s);
01404             int tc = q >> 4;
01405             int th = q & 15;
01406             if (tc > 1 || th > 3) return e("bad DHT header","Corrupt JPEG");
01407             for (i=0; i < 16; ++i) {
01408                sizes[i] = get8(&z->s);
01409                m += sizes[i];
01410             }
01411             L -= 17;
01412             if (tc == 0) {
01413                if (!build_huffman(z->huff_dc+th, sizes)) return 0;
01414                v = z->huff_dc[th].values;
01415             } else {
01416                if (!build_huffman(z->huff_ac+th, sizes)) return 0;
01417                v = z->huff_ac[th].values;
01418             }
01419             for (i=0; i < m; ++i)
01420                v[i] = get8u(&z->s);
01421             L -= m;
01422          }
01423          return L==0;
01424    }
01425    // check for comment block or APP blocks
01426    if ((m >= 0xE0 && m <= 0xEF) || m == 0xFE) {
01427       skip(&z->s, get16(&z->s)-2);
01428       return 1;
01429    }
01430    return 0;
01431 }
01432 
01433 // after we see SOS
01434 static int process_scan_header(jpeg *z)
01435 {
01436    int i;
01437    int Ls = get16(&z->s);
01438    z->scan_n = get8(&z->s);
01439    if (z->scan_n < 1 || z->scan_n > 4 || z->scan_n > (int) z->s.img_n) return e("bad SOS component count","Corrupt JPEG");
01440    if (Ls != 6+2*z->scan_n) return e("bad SOS len","Corrupt JPEG");
01441    for (i=0; i < z->scan_n; ++i) {
01442       int id = get8(&z->s), which;
01443       int q = get8(&z->s);
01444       for (which = 0; which < z->s.img_n; ++which)
01445          if (z->img_comp[which].id == id)
01446             break;
01447       if (which == z->s.img_n) return 0;
01448       z->img_comp[which].hd = q >> 4;   if (z->img_comp[which].hd > 3) return e("bad DC huff","Corrupt JPEG");
01449       z->img_comp[which].ha = q & 15;   if (z->img_comp[which].ha > 3) return e("bad AC huff","Corrupt JPEG");
01450       z->order[i] = which;
01451    }
01452    if (get8(&z->s) != 0) return e("bad SOS","Corrupt JPEG");
01453    get8(&z->s); // should be 63, but might be 0
01454    if (get8(&z->s) != 0) return e("bad SOS","Corrupt JPEG");
01455 
01456    return 1;
01457 }
01458 
01459 static int process_frame_header(jpeg *z, int scan)
01460 {
01461    stbi *s = &z->s;
01462    int Lf,p,i,q, h_max=1,v_max=1,c;
01463    Lf = get16(s);         if (Lf < 11) return e("bad SOF len","Corrupt JPEG"); // JPEG
01464    p  = get8(s);          if (p != 8) return e("only 8-bit","JPEG format not supported: 8-bit only"); // JPEG baseline
01465    s->img_y = get16(s);   if (s->img_y == 0) return e("no header height", "JPEG format not supported: delayed height"); // Legal, but we don't handle it--but neither does IJG
01466    s->img_x = get16(s);   if (s->img_x == 0) return e("0 width","Corrupt JPEG"); // JPEG requires
01467    c = get8(s);
01468    if (c != 3 && c != 1) return e("bad component count","Corrupt JPEG");    // JFIF requires
01469    s->img_n = c;
01470    for (i=0; i < c; ++i) {
01471       z->img_comp[i].data = NULL;
01472       z->img_comp[i].linebuf = NULL;
01473    }
01474 
01475    if (Lf != 8+3*s->img_n) return e("bad SOF len","Corrupt JPEG");
01476 
01477    for (i=0; i < s->img_n; ++i) {
01478       z->img_comp[i].id = get8(s);
01479       if (z->img_comp[i].id != i+1)   // JFIF requires
01480          if (z->img_comp[i].id != i)  // some version of jpegtran outputs non-JFIF-compliant files!
01481             return e("bad component ID","Corrupt JPEG");
01482       q = get8(s);
01483       z->img_comp[i].h = (q >> 4);  if (!z->img_comp[i].h || z->img_comp[i].h > 4) return e("bad H","Corrupt JPEG");
01484       z->img_comp[i].v = q & 15;    if (!z->img_comp[i].v || z->img_comp[i].v > 4) return e("bad V","Corrupt JPEG");
01485       z->img_comp[i].tq = get8(s);  if (z->img_comp[i].tq > 3) return e("bad TQ","Corrupt JPEG");
01486    }
01487 
01488    if (scan != SCAN_load) return 1;
01489 
01490    if ((1 << 30) / s->img_x / s->img_n < s->img_y) return e("too large", "Image too large to decode");
01491 
01492    for (i=0; i < s->img_n; ++i) {
01493       if (z->img_comp[i].h > h_max) h_max = z->img_comp[i].h;
01494       if (z->img_comp[i].v > v_max) v_max = z->img_comp[i].v;
01495    }
01496 
01497    // compute interleaved mcu info
01498    z->img_h_max = h_max;
01499    z->img_v_max = v_max;
01500    z->img_mcu_w = h_max * 8;
01501    z->img_mcu_h = v_max * 8;
01502    z->img_mcu_x = (s->img_x + z->img_mcu_w-1) / z->img_mcu_w;
01503    z->img_mcu_y = (s->img_y + z->img_mcu_h-1) / z->img_mcu_h;
01504 
01505    for (i=0; i < s->img_n; ++i) {
01506       // number of effective pixels (e.g. for non-interleaved MCU)
01507       z->img_comp[i].x = (s->img_x * z->img_comp[i].h + h_max-1) / h_max;
01508       z->img_comp[i].y = (s->img_y * z->img_comp[i].v + v_max-1) / v_max;
01509       // to simplify generation, we'll allocate enough memory to decode
01510       // the bogus oversized data from using interleaved MCUs and their
01511       // big blocks (e.g. a 16x16 iMCU on an image of width 33); we won't
01512       // discard the extra data until colorspace conversion
01513       z->img_comp[i].w2 = z->img_mcu_x * z->img_comp[i].h * 8;
01514       z->img_comp[i].h2 = z->img_mcu_y * z->img_comp[i].v * 8;
01515       z->img_comp[i].raw_data = malloc(z->img_comp[i].w2 * z->img_comp[i].h2+15);
01516       if (z->img_comp[i].raw_data == NULL) {
01517          for(--i; i >= 0; --i) {
01518             free(z->img_comp[i].raw_data);
01519             z->img_comp[i].data = NULL;
01520          }
01521          return e("outofmem", "Out of memory");
01522       }
01523       // align blocks for installable-idct using mmx/sse
01524       z->img_comp[i].data = (uint8*) (((size_t) z->img_comp[i].raw_data + 15) & ~15);
01525       z->img_comp[i].linebuf = NULL;
01526    }
01527 
01528    return 1;
01529 }
01530 
01531 // use comparisons since in some cases we handle more than one case (e.g. SOF)
01532 #define DNL(x)         ((x) == 0xdc)
01533 #define SOI(x)         ((x) == 0xd8)
01534 #define EOI(x)         ((x) == 0xd9)
01535 #define SOF(x)         ((x) == 0xc0 || (x) == 0xc1)
01536 #define SOS(x)         ((x) == 0xda)
01537 
01538 static int decode_jpeg_header(jpeg *z, int scan)
01539 {
01540    int m;
01541    z->marker = MARKER_none; // initialize cached marker to empty
01542    m = get_marker(z);
01543    if (!SOI(m)) return e("no SOI","Corrupt JPEG");
01544    if (scan == SCAN_type) return 1;
01545    m = get_marker(z);
01546    while (!SOF(m)) {
01547       if (!process_marker(z,m)) return 0;
01548       m = get_marker(z);
01549       while (m == MARKER_none) {
01550          // some files have extra padding after their blocks, so ok, we'll scan
01551          if (at_eof(&z->s)) return e("no SOF", "Corrupt JPEG");
01552          m = get_marker(z);
01553       }
01554    }
01555    if (!process_frame_header(z, scan)) return 0;
01556    return 1;
01557 }
01558 
01559 static int decode_jpeg_image(jpeg *j)
01560 {
01561    int m;
01562    j->restart_interval = 0;
01563    if (!decode_jpeg_header(j, SCAN_load)) return 0;
01564    m = get_marker(j);
01565    while (!EOI(m)) {
01566       if (SOS(m)) {
01567          if (!process_scan_header(j)) return 0;
01568          if (!parse_entropy_coded_data(j)) return 0;
01569       } else {
01570          if (!process_marker(j, m)) return 0;
01571       }
01572       m = get_marker(j);
01573    }
01574    return 1;
01575 }
01576 
01577 // static jfif-centered resampling (across block boundaries)
01578 
01579 typedef uint8 *(*resample_row_func)(uint8 *out, uint8 *in0, uint8 *in1,
01580                                     int w, int hs);
01581 
01582 #define div4(x) ((uint8) ((x) >> 2))
01583 
01584 static uint8 *resample_row_1(uint8 *out, uint8 *in_near, uint8 *in_far, int w, int hs)
01585 {
01586    return in_near;
01587 }
01588 
01589 static uint8* resample_row_v_2(uint8 *out, uint8 *in_near, uint8 *in_far, int w, int hs)
01590 {
01591    // need to generate two samples vertically for every one in input
01592    int i;
01593    for (i=0; i < w; ++i)
01594       out[i] = div4(3*in_near[i] + in_far[i] + 2);
01595    return out;
01596 }
01597 
01598 static uint8*  resample_row_h_2(uint8 *out, uint8 *in_near, uint8 *in_far, int w, int hs)
01599 {
01600    // need to generate two samples horizontally for every one in input
01601    int i;
01602    uint8 *input = in_near;
01603    if (w == 1) {
01604       // if only one sample, can't do any interpolation
01605       out[0] = out[1] = input[0];
01606       return out;
01607    }
01608 
01609    out[0] = input[0];
01610    out[1] = div4(input[0]*3 + input[1] + 2);
01611    for (i=1; i < w-1; ++i) {
01612       int n = 3*input[i]+2;
01613       out[i*2+0] = div4(n+input[i-1]);
01614       out[i*2+1] = div4(n+input[i+1]);
01615    }
01616    out[i*2+0] = div4(input[w-2]*3 + input[w-1] + 2);
01617    out[i*2+1] = input[w-1];
01618    return out;
01619 }
01620 
01621 #define div16(x) ((uint8) ((x) >> 4))
01622 
01623 static uint8 *resample_row_hv_2(uint8 *out, uint8 *in_near, uint8 *in_far, int w, int hs)
01624 {
01625    // need to generate 2x2 samples for every one in input
01626    int i,t0,t1;
01627    if (w == 1) {
01628       out[0] = out[1] = div4(3*in_near[0] + in_far[0] + 2);
01629       return out;
01630    }
01631 
01632    t1 = 3*in_near[0] + in_far[0];
01633    out[0] = div4(t1+2);
01634    for (i=1; i < w; ++i) {
01635       t0 = t1;
01636       t1 = 3*in_near[i]+in_far[i];
01637       out[i*2-1] = div16(3*t0 + t1 + 8);
01638       out[i*2  ] = div16(3*t1 + t0 + 8);
01639    }
01640    out[w*2-1] = div4(t1+2);
01641    return out;
01642 }
01643 
01644 static uint8 *resample_row_generic(uint8 *out, uint8 *in_near, uint8 *in_far, int w, int hs)
01645 {
01646    // resample with nearest-neighbor
01647    int i,j;
01648    for (i=0; i < w; ++i)
01649       for (j=0; j < hs; ++j)
01650          out[i*hs+j] = in_near[i];
01651    return out;
01652 }
01653 
01654 #define float2fixed(x)  ((int) ((x) * 65536 + 0.5))
01655 
01656 // 0.38 seconds on 3*anemones.jpg   (0.25 with processor = Pro)
01657 // VC6 without processor=Pro is generating multiple LEAs per multiply!
01658 static void YCbCr_to_RGB_row(uint8 *out, uint8 *y, uint8 *pcb, uint8 *pcr, int count, int step)
01659 {
01660    int i;
01661    for (i=0; i < count; ++i) {
01662       int y_fixed = (y[i] << 16) + 32768; // rounding
01663       int r,g,b;
01664       int cr = pcr[i] - 128;
01665       int cb = pcb[i] - 128;
01666       r = y_fixed + cr*float2fixed(1.40200f);
01667       g = y_fixed - cr*float2fixed(0.71414f) - cb*float2fixed(0.34414f);
01668       b = y_fixed                            + cb*float2fixed(1.77200f);
01669       r >>= 16;
01670       g >>= 16;
01671       b >>= 16;
01672       if ((unsigned) r > 255) { if (r < 0) r = 0; else r = 255; }
01673       if ((unsigned) g > 255) { if (g < 0) g = 0; else g = 255; }
01674       if ((unsigned) b > 255) { if (b < 0) b = 0; else b = 255; }
01675       out[0] = (uint8)r;
01676       out[1] = (uint8)g;
01677       out[2] = (uint8)b;
01678       out[3] = 255;
01679       out += step;
01680    }
01681 }
01682 
01683 #if STBI_SIMD
01684 static stbi_YCbCr_to_RGB_run stbi_YCbCr_installed = YCbCr_to_RGB_row;
01685 
01686 void stbi_install_YCbCr_to_RGB(stbi_YCbCr_to_RGB_run func)
01687 {
01688    stbi_YCbCr_installed = func;
01689 }
01690 #endif
01691 
01692 
01693 // clean up the temporary component buffers
01694 static void cleanup_jpeg(jpeg *j)
01695 {
01696    int i;
01697    for (i=0; i < j->s.img_n; ++i) {
01698       if (j->img_comp[i].data) {
01699          free(j->img_comp[i].raw_data);
01700          j->img_comp[i].data = NULL;
01701       }
01702       if (j->img_comp[i].linebuf) {
01703          free(j->img_comp[i].linebuf);
01704          j->img_comp[i].linebuf = NULL;
01705       }
01706    }
01707 }
01708 
01709 typedef struct
01710 {
01711    resample_row_func resample;
01712    uint8 *line0,*line1;
01713    int hs,vs;   // expansion factor in each axis
01714    int w_lores; // horizontal pixels pre-expansion 
01715    int ystep;   // how far through vertical expansion we are
01716    int ypos;    // which pre-expansion row we're on
01717 } stbi_resample;
01718 
01719 static uint8 *load_jpeg_image(jpeg *z, int *out_x, int *out_y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01720 {
01721    int n, decode_n;
01722    // validate req_comp
01723    if (req_comp < 0 || req_comp > 4) return epuc("bad req_comp", "Internal error");
01724    z->s.img_n = 0;
01725 
01726    // load a jpeg image from whichever source
01727    if (!decode_jpeg_image(z)) { cleanup_jpeg(z); return NULL; }
01728 
01729    // determine actual number of components to generate
01730    n = req_comp ? req_comp : z->s.img_n;
01731 
01732    if (z->s.img_n == 3 && n < 3)
01733       decode_n = 1;
01734    else
01735       decode_n = z->s.img_n;
01736 
01737    // resample and color-convert
01738    {
01739       int k;
01740       uint i,j;
01741       uint8 *output;
01742       uint8 *coutput[4];
01743 
01744       stbi_resample res_comp[4];
01745 
01746       for (k=0; k < decode_n; ++k) {
01747          stbi_resample *r = &res_comp[k];
01748 
01749          // allocate line buffer big enough for upsampling off the edges
01750          // with upsample factor of 4
01751          z->img_comp[k].linebuf = (uint8 *) malloc(z->s.img_x + 3);
01752          if (!z->img_comp[k].linebuf) { cleanup_jpeg(z); return epuc("outofmem", "Out of memory"); }
01753 
01754          r->hs      = z->img_h_max / z->img_comp[k].h;
01755          r->vs      = z->img_v_max / z->img_comp[k].v;
01756          r->ystep   = r->vs >> 1;
01757          r->w_lores = (z->s.img_x + r->hs-1) / r->hs;
01758          r->ypos    = 0;
01759          r->line0   = r->line1 = z->img_comp[k].data;
01760 
01761          if      (r->hs == 1 && r->vs == 1) r->resample = resample_row_1;
01762          else if (r->hs == 1 && r->vs == 2) r->resample = resample_row_v_2;
01763          else if (r->hs == 2 && r->vs == 1) r->resample = resample_row_h_2;
01764          else if (r->hs == 2 && r->vs == 2) r->resample = resample_row_hv_2;
01765          else                               r->resample = resample_row_generic;
01766       }
01767 
01768       // can't error after this so, this is safe
01769       output = (uint8 *) malloc(n * z->s.img_x * z->s.img_y + 1);
01770       if (!output) { cleanup_jpeg(z); return epuc("outofmem", "Out of memory"); }
01771 
01772       // now go ahead and resample
01773       for (j=0; j < z->s.img_y; ++j) {
01774          uint8 *out = output + n * z->s.img_x * j;
01775          for (k=0; k < decode_n; ++k) {
01776             stbi_resample *r = &res_comp[k];
01777             int y_bot = r->ystep >= (r->vs >> 1);
01778             coutput[k] = r->resample(z->img_comp[k].linebuf,
01779                                      y_bot ? r->line1 : r->line0,
01780                                      y_bot ? r->line0 : r->line1,
01781                                      r->w_lores, r->hs);
01782             if (++r->ystep >= r->vs) {
01783                r->ystep = 0;
01784                r->line0 = r->line1;
01785                if (++r->ypos < z->img_comp[k].y)
01786                   r->line1 += z->img_comp[k].w2;
01787             }
01788          }
01789          if (n >= 3) {
01790             uint8 *y = coutput[0];
01791             if (z->s.img_n == 3) {
01792                #if STBI_SIMD
01793                stbi_YCbCr_installed(out, y, coutput[1], coutput[2], z->s.img_x, n);
01794                #else
01795                YCbCr_to_RGB_row(out, y, coutput[1], coutput[2], z->s.img_x, n);
01796                #endif
01797             } else
01798                for (i=0; i < z->s.img_x; ++i) {
01799                   out[0] = out[1] = out[2] = y[i];
01800                   out[3] = 255; // not used if n==3
01801                   out += n;
01802                }
01803          } else {
01804             uint8 *y = coutput[0];
01805             if (n == 1)
01806                for (i=0; i < z->s.img_x; ++i) out[i] = y[i];
01807             else
01808                for (i=0; i < z->s.img_x; ++i) *out++ = y[i], *out++ = 255;
01809          }
01810       }
01811       cleanup_jpeg(z);
01812       *out_x = z->s.img_x;
01813       *out_y = z->s.img_y;
01814       if (comp) *comp  = z->s.img_n; // report original components, not output
01815       return output;
01816    }
01817 }
01818 
01819 #ifndef STBI_NO_STDIO
01820 unsigned char *stbi_jpeg_load_from_file(FILE *f, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01821 {
01822    jpeg j;
01823    start_file(&j.s, f);
01824    return load_jpeg_image(&j, x,y,comp,req_comp);
01825 }
01826 
01827 unsigned char *stbi_jpeg_load(char const *filename, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01828 {
01829    unsigned char *data;
01830    FILE *f = fopen(filename, "rb");
01831    if (!f) return NULL;
01832    data = stbi_jpeg_load_from_file(f,x,y,comp,req_comp);
01833    fclose(f);
01834    return data;
01835 }
01836 #endif
01837 
01838 unsigned char *stbi_jpeg_load_from_memory(stbi_uc const *buffer, int len, int *x, int *y, int *comp, int req_comp)
01839 {
01840    jpeg j;
01841    start_mem(&j.s, buffer,len);
01842    return load_jpeg_image(&j, x,y,comp,req_comp);
01843 }
